hackathon-description-text: Join us for the second WebVR hackathon in New York. The first outing was a ton of fun, and this time we're going to do it all weekend.
hackathon-eligibility:
Open to all.
Participants must bring their own laptop.
Not responsible for dietary restrictions and/or allergies.
If special arrangements are needed for accessibility, please contact organizers one week or more in advance.
hackathon-requirements: All projects must be submitted to this Devpost site, and be viewable on some broadly available browser. Browser limitations should be specified in the submission.
hackathon-rules:
All projects must be original.
All projects must be viewable on a web browser.

We have a zero-tolerance policy for harassment of any kind. This is a community event and all members are equally welcome and to be respected at all times. This includes disparaging comments, sexualized language, imagery, jokes, stories, references, and other communications of a sexual, racial, gender, age nature.
We support divesity and inclusion. This includes those who are earlier on their learning journey, from an age, experience, or ability standpoint. It is crucial for the growth of our community that those of greater ability support and mentor those still learning.
Any disparaging comments, imagery, stories, jokes or other communications will be met with immediate explusion. 
Please contact the organizers directly or via anonymous email with any questions or concerns.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1 year Sketchfab pro, blog feature, social feature, press release, cardboard, shirt
6m Sketchfab pro, blog honorable mention, social feature, cardboard, shirt
3m Sketchfab pro, blog honorable mention, social feature, cardboard, shirt

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1123 Broadway #501, New York, NY 10010, USA
hackathon-description-header: Create WebVR awesomeness with SketchFab, Amper music, other APIs
